titles.title: Bishoujo Yuugi Unit Crane Game Galaxy
美少女遊戯ユニットクレーンゲール Galaxy
Crane Game Girls Galaxy

anime.description: Earth is about to be destroyed by a meteor! The beautiful Sayo is told by the upper management at her mysterious organization that the only ones who can save the planet are three girls named Kyouko, Asuka, and Mirai. Although skeptical, Sayo brings them together by telling them they`re going to train to be idols. They`re raring to go, but for some reason, she leads them to an arcade... Source: crunchyroll

tag.name: dynamic
tag.description: Some of the central structural elements in anime are: Plot Continuity How does the plot or several plots unfold. Are they a strictly linear retelling of one big continuing story, a serial, possibly with several side stories, or is the content chopped into a set of unconnected episodes, only sharing the same setting and characters? Stereotype Characters Then there is the question of the character set presentation. Is it completely original, or is it your usual stereotypical character cast. Both choices have their merit, for example it would not really make much sense to reinvent the wheel for a harem anime. Fans of that genre come to expect their favourite stereotype protagonists. Plot Twists Finally there is the question of how complex the plot / the story unfolds. Are there side-plots that merge into the main plot leading to unexpected plot twists, or is the anime quite predictable? The latter would not be appropriate for detective stories. In harem anime on the other hand a foreseeable outcome is actually something the fans will come to expect.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: setting
tag.description: The setting describes in what time and place an anime takes place. To a certain extent it describes what you can expect from the world in the anime.

tag.name: elements
tag.description: Next to Themes setting the backdrop for the protagonists in anime, there are the more detailed plot Elements that centre on character interactions: "What do characters do to each other or what is done to them?". Is it violent Action, an awe-inspiring Adventure in a foreign place, the gripping life of a Detective, a slapstick Comedy, an Ecchi Harem anime, a SciFi epic, or some Fantasy travelling adventure?

tag.name: place
tag.description: The places the anime can take place in. Includes more specific places such as a country on Earth, as well as more general places such as a dystopia or a mirror world.

tag.name: shipboard
tag.description: Beam me up, Scotty! Space stations (think Death Star) also count. Basically, this category is to tell if the setting takes place onboard a spaceship in space. This category is not applicable if the spaceship lies on a planet and never actually gets into space.

tag.name: new
tag.description: Not based on anything, the story is a new work, usually made up by the people involved in creating the anime. Generally if an original work (原作) credit is given, it will be to the studio, or director, or other members of the production team.

tag.name: action
tag.description: Action anime usually involve a fairly straightforward story of good guys versus bad guys, where most disputes are resolved by using physical force. It often contains a lot of shooting, explosions and fighting.

tag.name: comedy
tag.description: Anime whose central struggle causes hilarious results. These stories are built upon funny characters, situations and events. A comedy anime is laced with humour and sets out to provoke laughter from the audience. Japanese humour can be a bit strange to westerners, so if you`re new to this type of humour, just bear with it; it`ll most likely grow on you if you`re a fan of other kinds of comedy.

tag.name: space battles
tag.description: There are space battles in this anime. Usually between Earth forces and some alien invader, but ship to ship skirmishes in deep space are just as common.

tag.name: predominantly female cast
tag.description: A show with a predominantly female cast has mostly females as main and secondary cast members while few if any male characters have major roles. This also applies when a male lead is surrounded by females of lesser individual plot relevance, such as in a harem setting.

tag.name: technical aspects
tag.description: It may sometimes be useful to know about technical aspects of a show, such as information about its broadcasting or censorship. Such information can be found here.

tag.name: half-length episodes
tag.description: Half-length episodes are regular episodes that are somewhat shorter than the standard length. This includes episodes that are 11 to 20 minutes in length; shows with episodes up to and including 10 minutes are http://anidb.net/t5852 [short episodes] instead.

episode.title: 極めろ? アイドルのマスター!
Master It? The Idol Masters!
Kiwamero? Idol no Master!
episode.summary: Dark Cherry has a sudden thought: What if they fought their idol battles by... actually singing?! But putting that idea into practice turns out to be harder than it seems... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: アイ アム アイドル!
I Am Idol!
I Am Idol!
episode.summary: It`s time for the Earth Defense Idols and Dark Cherry to battle again! Their choice of weapon? Introduction speeches! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 毛布の中に秘めた想い
Feelings Hidden in a Blanket
Moufu no Naka ni Himeta Omoi
episode.summary: All is not well with the Earth invasion idols, Dark Cherry. Can Lumie and Hikaru convince Rei to come out of her room? And who is their mysterious mentor? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 襲来! ダークチェリー
The Attack of Dark Cherry
Shuurai! Dark Cherry
episode.summary: The Crane Game Girls are back, and ready to defend the Earth! But Dark Gorilla has a plan, too... his own set of idols! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 未来世紀アイドル
Future Century Idols
Mirai Seiki Idol
episode.summary: After finding Dark Cherry living as nuns, the Crane Game Girls attempt to bring them back into the world of idols! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: アイドルクエストIII そして悟りへ...
Idol Quest III: And Then to Enlightenment...
Idol Quest III: Soshite Satori e...
episode.summary: A humiliated Dark Cherry has decided to quit being idols! What careers will they make for themselves out in the real world? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: A Perfect World
A Perfect World
A Perfect World
episode.summary: The Earth invasion idols sneak onto Earth to find out the secrets of the Crane Game Girls! If there are any secrets to discover. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 時をかける思い
Emotions That Leapt Through Time
Toki o Kakeru Omoi
episode.summary: To try to get to the heart of Saya`s betrayal, Tokiko flashes back to their high school days together. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: Episode 12
episode.summary: After saving the world, Super Shiny Galaxy is supposed to hold a concert for all the people in the world. But... where are the idols themselves?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ゴリラ最後の日
Gorilla`s Last Day
Gorilla Saigo no Hi
episode.summary: Super Shiny Galaxy faces off with Dark Gorilla and learns the true reason behind the invasion of Earth! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ギリギリ最強ギャラクシー!
Super-Close Ultimate Galaxy!
Girigiri Saikyou Galaxy!
episode.summary: Super Shiny Galaxy advances through the ranks at the Cosmic Idol Festival... but not everybody is celebrating their success! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 飛び出せ, ゴリの穴!
Jump out, Goril Hole!
Tobidasu, Gori no Ana!
episode.summary: Saya the Gorillac Knight reveals her plan: to have the Crane Game Girls and Dark Cherry form a single unit, and take part in the Cosmic Idol Festival! Source: crunchyroll
